meanings.definition: A person or thing that does not start or begin.
meanings.sent1: The race had many nonstarters who never even made it to the starting line.
meanings.sent2: In a marathon, the nonstarters are those who decide not to participate.
meanings.sent3: The nonstarters in the relay race were the ones who forgot to pass the baton.
meanings.sent4: The nonstarters in the classroom were the students who arrived late and missed the instructions.
meanings.sent5: The team had to replace the nonstarters with substitutes to ensure everyone could participate.

meanings.definition: An idea or plan that is not feasible or likely to succeed.
meanings.sent1: The proposal to build a roller coaster on the moon was considered a nonstarter by the committee.
meanings.sent2: Investing all your money in a risky venture is a nonstarter for financial stability.
meanings.sent3: Trying to teach a fish to climb a tree is a nonstarter in the world of education.
meanings.sent4: Expecting a plant to grow without sunlight is a nonstarter in gardening.
meanings.sent5: Hoping to win the lottery without buying a ticket is a nonstarter in the realm of luck.
